qas.question: What was the event called that caused  Ayutthaya  to reclaim lost territories ?
In what year did  Ayutthaya capture Lan Na  ?
What country was Burma at war with with until 1855 ?
Who managed to eventually control the territory of Arakan

context: With Burma preoccupied by <a0_0>the Chinese threat<a0_0/>, Ayutthaya recovered its territories by 1770, and went on to capture Lan Na by <a1_0>1776.<a1_0/> Burma and Siam went to war until 1855, but all resulted in a stalemate, exchanging Tenasserim (to Burma) and Lan Na (to Ayutthaya). Faced with a powerful China and a resurgent Ayutthaya in the east, <a3_0>King Bodawpaya<a3_0/> turned west, acquiring <a2_0>Arakan<a2_0/> (1785), Manipur (1814) and Assam (1817). It was the second-largest empire in Burmese history but also one with a long ill-defined border with British India.
